Solar-Powered Lanterns: Invest in solar-powered lanterns that can be charged during the day and provide light at night. These lanterns can be placed in different areas of the house or community to ensure even distribution of light.

Light-Emitting Plants: Utilize plants that have light-emitting properties, such as glowing mushrooms or plants that emit light at night. These plants can be placed in different areas of the house or community to provide natural light.

Solar-Powered Windows: Install solar-powered windows that can convert sunlight into electricity during the day and provide light at night. These windows can be installed in rooms that don't receive direct sunlight, ensuring that all areas of the house or community have access to light.

LED Light Paint: Develop a special type of paint that emits light, similar to glow-in-the-dark paint. This paint can be applied to walls, ceilings, and other surfaces, providing a soft and even light source throughout the house or community.

Cloud-Seeding Technology: Utilize cloud-seeding technology to induce artificial lightning storms that can provide light during the day. This technology can be used in areas with low light levels, ensuring that everyone has access to enough light.
